title: Scout Motors' Electric Trucks Will Have Real Buttons
description: Finally, an EV that doesn't want to dominate your life with screens.
context: When Scout Motors' first electric trucks and SUVs roll off the assembly line in 2026, they will attempt to conquer the American market in ways that parent company Volkswagen has never been able to pull off before. And they will do this with something that's an increasing rarity in the growing electric market: actual, physical buttons.
author: Patrick George

title: The Toyota bZ4X Is Depreciating Massively. But Why?
description: We spoke with two automotive experts to find out what's going on with the e-TNGA EV prices.
context: Toyota and Subaru products have some of the best resale values of any mass-market cars. In the luxury world, Lexus vehicles hold onto their values better than products from Mercedes-Benz, BMW, Audi, and others. But while that holds for internal-combustion cars, the depreciation curve is different for the brands’ early electric efforts. The Toyota bZ4X, Subaru Solterra, and Lexus RZ all lie within that category.
author: Andrew Lambrecht

title: Ford Killed Its Small Cars. Now It Says Small, Profitable EVs Are A Must
description: Ford doubled-down on trucks and SUVs. Now it's realizing smaller might be better.
context: If you've been interested in a smaller vehicle from the Ford Motor Company—say, a Focus or a Fiesta or a Fusion, something like that—you've unfortunately been out of luck for years now. Back in 2018, when gas was extra cheap, interest rates were low and no high-tech Chinese automakers were posting up in Mexico and waiting to pounce, Ford made a certain strategic decision to maximize profits. Under then-CEO Jim Hackett, Ford famously killed all of its cars in North America except the Mustang and Ford Focus Active, which was later canceled as well.
author: Patrick George

title: This Is Volvo Trucks’ First Electric-Only Model: FM Low Entry
description: An all-electric truck ready for heavy loads and efficient driving in city areas.
context: Volvo Trucks moves forward with the electrification of its truck lineup, introducing another (its eighth) all-electric truck model.
author: Mark Kane

title: Ex-GM Truck Exec On The Tesla Cybertruck: Make It Cheaper And More People Will Want It
description: Terry Woychowski was the Chief Engineer for GM’s Full-Size Truck Platform in the 2000s. Think Chevy Silverado and the original Hummer.
context: The Tesla Cybertruck is arguably the most controversial pickup in recent history, with its angular design, stainless steel body panels, and bold claims about capability. Ever since it was revealed in 2019, people argued whether or not Tesla’s first-ever truck can actually do truck things.
author: Iulian Dnistran

title: Rivian R2: Here's A Shadowy First Look
description: Surprise! It looks like a Rivian.
context: Earlier this month, Rivian announced that its highly anticipated R2 model, potentially a mid-size SUV or crossover, was set to be unveiled on March 7, 2024. Leading up to the unveiling event next month at the Laguna Beach showroom in Orange County, California, Rivian is stoking enthusiasts' curiosity with the release of the R2's first official teaser.
author: Suvrat Kothari

title: GM’s Super Cruise Now Works On 750,000 Miles Of Roads
description: The update nearly doubles the number of highway miles in North America where users can drive hands-free.
context: Super Cruise, General Motors’ advanced driver-assistance system (ADAS), is getting a big update that will almost double the number of highway miles where owners of compatible cars can activate the feature.
author: Iulian Dnistran

title: Sacramento Looks to Ban New Gas Stations
description: Plus, Ford calls Chinese EVs a "colossal" threat and the U.S. issued $135 Million in EV tax credits so far in 2024.
context: Spring is just a month away, and that means out with the old, in with the new. Apparently Sacramento, California feels that way too, but about its vehicle support infrastructure. The Golden State's capital city may soon become one of the major cities aiming to ban the construction or expansion of gas stations.
author: Rob Stumpf

title: Kia EV9 Has Ample Room Inside And Decent Handling, Says Consumer Reports
description: CR’s early owner’s review of the electric three-row SUV also points out some annoying things.
context: The Kia EV9 is kind of the all-electric equivalent of the Telluride. The pair of three-row SUVs are almost identical in size, but the fact that the EV9 has an all-electric powertrain has several advantages over its combustion-powered stablemate. However, there are some things in the zero-emissions SUV that might annoy owners.
author: Iulian Dnistran

title: Tesla Cybertruck Owners Report 'Rust Spots.' Here's How To Remove Them
description: You might even have these rather cheap products at home right now, which makes the task even easier.
context: The Tesla Cybertruck's stainless steel body panels get dirty, discolored and show signs of "corrosion," but there's a simple two-step cheap method to fix these issues.
author: Eric Loveday

title: The Lucid Air Pure Just Got A $7,500 Price Cut
description: It may not qualify for a $7,500 credit from the federal government, but Lucid's covering the gap.
context: The Lucid Air Pure is too expensive to qualify for the revised $7500 federal tax credit. The price cap for qualifying sedans is $55,000, and the Lucid Air Pure RWD model started at $77,400. But Lucid announced a price cut Thursday, dropping the entrance cost of the luxury sedan to $69,900.
author: Mack Hogan

title: The 2024 Ypsilon Is Lancia's First New Car In 13 Years
description: The troubled Italian brand signals rebirth with its first-ever EV.
context: We never thought this day would ever come again, but here is a new Lancia. Stellantis has pledged to keep all 14 (fourteen!) brands in its vast portfolio following the FCA-PSA merger. That means the Italian marque is getting a new chance to repair its severely damaged brand image. The 2024 Ypsilon kicks off a long overdue rebirth.
author: Adrian Padeanu

title: French Government's €100-A-Month EV Leasing Plan Falls Victim To Its Own Success
description: Demand far outstripped supply after an affordable EV leasing program received an overwhelming response.
context: In December 2023, the French government kicked off an ambitious program to encourage low-income households to buy electric cars and to broaden the appeal of EVs.
author: Suvrat Kothari

title: Tesla Model 3 Long Range Gets Second Price Hike This Month
description: And you'll have to wait longer to get it.
context: Tesla has increased the price of the Tesla Model 3 Long Range AWD by $500. It's the second time Tesla has hiked the Long Range's price this month.
author: Mark Kane

title: Volkswagen’s First EV Came 50 Years Before The ID. Buzz, Battery Swapping Included
description: A fleet of converted T2 vans was created in the 1970s to explore alternative energy sources.
context: The Volkswagen ID. Buzz is the German carmaker’s first mass-produced all-electric minivan, and it’s a pretty cool, modern nod to VW’s first-ever van–the iconic Type 2 Microbus, also known as the T1.
author: Iulian Dnistran

title: Lack Of Exposure, Experience Is Also Hurting EV Sales: Consumer Reports
description: Also on tap: Chrysler's new concept touts advanced but MIA battery tech, and yes, the Sony-Honda Afeela deal is still happening.
context: I think every electric vehicle owner has had that "a-ha" moment; that instance when you just sort of get how everything works, when fear gives way to excitement about the advantages of moving on from gasoline, when everything clicks. Sometimes that happens behind the wheel. Other times, it happens when someone you know and trust can show you the way.
author: Patrick George

title: There's A CHAdeMO To CCS Adapter, But I'm Not Sure I'd Use It
description: A Finnish YouTuber has an adapter that allows his CHAdeMO-equipped Nissan Leaf to charge at CCS DC fast-charging stations, but the CHAdeMO association isn't sure if this is safe.
context: God bless CHAdeMO. It was the DC fast-charging plug shape that was poised to win the charger format wars, purely by being installed on the only EVs capable of fast charging in their day, the Nissan Leaf and Mitsubishi i-MiEV. Alas, it didn’t succeed. Most DC fast charging stations are now CCS only and will soon pivot to NACS. Most fast charging service providers have also announced that they’ll be sunsetting support for the CHAdeMO. Yet, the lack of support for CHAdeMO is a serious issue. Nissan still sells a brand new Leaf that can only DC fast charge via a CHAdeMO connector. In a CCS and NACS world, what does that mean for Leaf owners who want to fast charge?
author: Kevin Williams

title: A Porsche Luxury Electric Minivan Would Be “Very Interesting,” Says Design Boss
description: Ferrari made an SUV and now Porsche is thinking about making an electric minivan. Has the world gone crazy?
context: Porsche made everybody mad when it introduced the first-generation Cayenne two decades ago, only to rake in profits from it and become bigger and better than ever. But the Cayenne–and the even more successful Macan that followed–are SUVs, and everybody knows SUVs are the silver bullet in today’s car market.
author: Iulian Dnistran

title: The Lucid Gravity Team Offers A Detailed Walkaround Overview
description: We get the inside scoop on the upcoming electric SUV's design and UX details.
context: Lucid Motors second offering, an electric SUV called Gravity, is expected to begin shipping to customers by the end of 2024.
author: Tom Moloughney

title: GM Wants To Go EV-Only By 2035. Its CEO Says The Push Will ‘Be Guided By The Consumer’
description: 2024 is “the year of execution” for GM, CEO Marry Barra said.
context: This year, General Motors will have to prove that it’s capable of ramping up production of its Ultium-based electric vehicle portfolio, which includes names like the Cadillac Lyriq, Chevrolet Equinox EV, and GMC Hummer EV.
author: Iulian Dnistran

title: 10 Reasons To Consider An Electric Car In 2024
description: For starters, the available electric vehicles continue to grow on almost a weekly basis.
context: Electric vehicle ownership is no longer the niche, climate-saving activity it once was and has entered the mainstream, with many previous skeptics fully jumping on board. Even so, there are plenty of people, both current owners and others, who (rightfully) feel that the situation needs to be explained further.
author: Chris Teague

title: LG Energy Solution's 4680-Type Batteries Are Coming 'Soon'

context: LG Energy Solution (LGES), one of the world's largest manufacturers of lithium-ion batteries for EVs, is expected to soon launch new high-capacity cylindrical battery cells.

author: Eric Loveday

title: Rivian R2: Is This It?
description: The company’s new, smaller, and more affordable EV will debut on March 7.
context: Images of what appears to be the all-new Rivian R2 SUV have made their way online ahead of the EV’s official debut on March 7. The Californian startup’s third model will arguably be its most important product, carrying a price tag of around $40,000 to $60,000.
author: Iulian Dnistran

title: Plug-In Car Sales In Germany Rebound In January 2024
description: However, the results are still lower than two years ago.
context: In January, new passenger car registrations in Germany amounted to 213,553, up 19% year-over-year. That's the best January since 2020 (246,300).
author: Mark Kane

title: Scout Motors Electric Truck Could Be In High $40,000 Range, No Plans For Hybrid: CEO
description: It may be more expensive than the $40,000 price point that was tossed around, but the Volkswagen Group has big plans for Scout Motors.
context: When the Volkswagen Group unleashes the first Scout Motors electric trucks and SUVs in 2026, those vehicles will aim for the heart of America like no Golf or Tiguan could ever do. The Scouts are said to be rugged, "heritage-inspired" EVs that pay homage to one of the godfathers of the off-roading world. Given how popular retro SUVs like the Ford Bronco and Land Rover Defender are, the brand seems poised to be a hit—if the specs and price are right.
author: Patrick George

title: Tesla Sparked A Car Software War. It’s Not Going So Hot
description: Carmakers are laser-focused on transforming into tech companies. Getting there is proving harder than expected.
context: In late 2012, a young upstart car company called Tesla Motors beamed out a software update to its earliest sedans. When tethered to a WiFi or 3G internet connection, Model S owners could download a tweak to their music player and some other features. It was a minor change, but one with profound reverberations that continue to this day.
author: Tim Levin

title: Rivian Lays Off Another 10% Of Salaried Staff
description: The EV startup said it faces "economic and geopolitical uncertainties" throughout 2024.
context: Rivian is laying off 10% of its salaried workforce, the EV startup announced on Wednesday as it reported fourth-quarter and full-year earnings. It's the company's second round of layoffs in the past year.
author: Tim Levin

title: Rivian R1T And R1S Owners Figured Out How To Play Videos On The Central Display
description: It’s not perfect, but it’s still better than nothing.
context: The Rivian R1T pickup and R1S SUV are some of the best $70,000+ EVs you can get right now, but they’re not perfect. They have a lot of bells and whistles, but even three years after the R1T went into production, Rivian hasn’t figured out a way to get streaming services like YouTube, Netlifx, or Amazon Prime on the EV’s main screen.
author: Iulian Dnistran

title: The Rivian R2 Will Be Eligible For The $7,500 Tax Credit: CEO
description: RJ Scaringe said in an interview with Forbes that there’s a lack of choice in the EV space and that $48,000 is a pricing “sweet spot.”
context: The upcoming Rivian R2 EV, which will be unveiled on March 7, will be eligible for the full $7,500 tax credit, CEO RJ Scaringe said during an interview with Forbes. Currently, the all-electric R1S SUV and R1T pickup are eligible for a $3,750 tax credit when purchasing but only if the MSRP is under $80,000. Leasing, however, unlocks the full credit whatever the MSRP.
author: Iulian Dnistran

title: Fisker Ocean Owners Love The Cars. Just Not The Bugs
description: As complaints around quality problems and customer service pile up, some are losing patience.
context: By the time Cory’s Fisker Ocean One arrived in October, he already had a bad feeling about the SUV. Problems with early owners’ cars and delays in receiving his own vehicle gave him pause, but he decided to take delivery anyway rather than lose his $5,000 deposit, he told InsideEVs.
author: Tim Levin

title: 2025 Ram 1500 Ramcharger With 'Unlimited' Battery Range: Watch First-Ever Walkaround Video
description: This is the first time Ram has allowed the media to check out the 2025 Ramcharger.
context: The 2025 Ram Ramcharger has 141 miles of electric range, plus it has a range-extending gasoline engine that brings its total range to 690 miles, which beats every other electric truck.
author: Eric Loveday

title: 2024 Cadillac Lyriq Regains $7,500 Federal Tax Credit
description: General Motors changed the sourcing for two minor components to make the electric Caddy regain its tax credit eligibility.
context: The Cadillac Lyriq, the automaker’s sharp-looking and swanky entrant to the growing world of luxury electric vehicles, has regained its federal tax credit eligibility.
author: Suvrat Kothari

title: Latest Research Shows Lithium Metal Batteries Can Be 'Revived'
description: We spoke with Stanford's Dr. Yi Cui about his latest research on "reversing" degradation in lithium-metal batteries.
context: Individually, each battery cell is small and seemingly insignificant. However, when hundreds of these cells are connected in series and parallel, they comprise the principal component of an electric car's powertrain. That's why finding a cell chemistry that maximizes energy density and longevity is essential for powering the EVs of tomorrow. One possible next-gen chemistry is lithium metal due to its highly energy-dense characteristics. Stanford's Precourt Institute for Energy has recently discovered that lithium metal batteries also exhibit a fascinating characteristic: lost capacity due to degradation can be recovered.
author: Andrew Lambrecht

title: Stellantis, Volkswagen And Renault Consider Cheap EV Team-Up To Fight BYD
description: Plus, the environmental value of hybrids gets questioned by green groups, and yes, batteries are getting cheaper.
context: Almost a decade ago now, the late, great CEO of what was then called Fiat Chrysler penned a manifesto of sorts called Confessions of a Capital Junkie. In it, Sergio Marchionne argued the auto industry would do well to consider more consolidations and team-ups to drive down enormous R&D costs, meet emissions and safety requirements together and deal with the fact that all their competing 2.0-liter turbo four-cylinder engines drove the same anyway.
author: Patrick George

title: Kia EV9 Owner After 1,000 Miles: It’s Rock Solid
description: The South Korean automaker’s first all-electric three-row SUV is being reviewed by more and more new owners.
context: The Kia EV9 is marketed by the South Korean automaker as being its top-of-the-line model, regardless of propulsion type. Even though it’s similar in size to the gas-powered Telluride, the EV9 is more expensive and somewhat posher inside.
author: Iulian Dnistran

title: The Super-Cheap Dacia Spring EV Can Now Power Your Appliances Too
description: With incentives, this electric runabout can cost as low as $13,000 in some places.
context: The Dacia Spring might not ring a bell in the United States, but in Europe, it’s known as one of the cheapest electric cars on the market. It’s small, it doesn’t have a lot of range, and it’s not particularly powerful, but with a price as low as $13,000 (12,000 Euro) after incentives, it’s hard not to consider it when buying a new car for urban driving.
author: Iulian Dnistran

title: You Need Way Less EV Range Than You Think: Study
description: Data from thousands of EVs shows the average daily driving distance is a small percentage of the EPA range of most EVs.
context: For years, range anxiety has been a major barrier to wider EV adoption in the U.S. It's a common fear: imagine being in the middle of nowhere, with 5% juice remaining in your battery, and nowhere to charge. A nightmare nobody ever wants to experience, right? But a new study proves that in the real world, that's a highly improbable scenario.
author: Suvrat Kothari

title: You Can Now Find Used Tesla Model S Plaids For Around $60,000
description: Compared to an original asking price of $131,440, some used Plaids have lost over half their value.
context: Used Tesla Model S Plaids are quickly lowering in price. Today, used examples are in the $60,000 range with relatively low miles. The Model S Plaid cost $131,440 in 2021, so buyers can find these sedans for nearly half their original prices. But here's the kicker: a 2024 Tesla Model S Plaid now starts at $91,630. So, for those who bought one in 2021, their cars instantly became worth $39,810 less to savvy buyers. Add luxury sedan depreciation into the mix, and Model S Plaids are going for nowhere near what they were going for.
author: Andrew Lambrecht

title: Scout Motors Aims To Help Volkswagen Do What It's Never Done: Conquer America
description: Company executives tell InsideEVs about the Scout SUV platform, plans for batteries and dealerships, and the "electric slowdown."
context: The forest site in Blythewood, South Carolina currently being cleared to make room for Scout Motors’ future electric truck and SUV factory is a very big deal on multiple fronts.
author: Patrick George

title: The Arc Sport Is A $258,000 Electric Wake Boat With 570 HP
description: The zero-emissions wave cruiser is made by a Los Angeles-based startup.
context: Electric boats are slowly but surely going mainstream. After companies like Polestar and Porsche put their names (and electric tech) on a couple of high-end water cruisers, now an American company is bringing a new electric boat to market that’s touted as being more advanced than any of its rivals.

title: We Have A Tesla Cybertruck. What Do You Want To Know?

title: Bidirectional Charging EVs: V2G, V2H, And V2L Explained
description: Some electric vehicles don’t just take electricity and use it for their own propulsion; they can also power some of your everyday needs.
context: Bidirectional charging is becoming more common in electric vehicles, and buyers are increasingly looking for models that offer this capability. As the name implies, it means that an EV can not only take electricity and store it in its battery pack, but it can also provide electricity to power devices, appliances, and even power tools.

title: Dealers Are Having a Bad Time With the EV Tax Credit

description:

The number of electric vehicle models that can be leased for less than an average monthly lease cost of $400/month has grown by 50% since last August. Two of those EV models have a range of over 300 miles.

title: BMW Issues A Recall for 79,670 Vehicles
description:
BMW has initiated a recall affecting nearly 79,670 vehicles from its 2023 and 2024 lineup due to a flaw in the ABS and stability control systems. The issue stems from a flaw in the vehicle’s...

First published by https://www.bmwblog.com
context: BMW has initiated a recall affecting nearly 79,670 vehicles from its 2023 and 2024 lineup due to a flaw in the ABS and stability control systems. The issue stems from a flaw in the vehicle’s electronically managed integrated braking system, which could lead to a loss of power braking assist, antilock braking (ABS), and dynamic stability control (DSC). While drivers will retain the ability to halt the vehicle through mechanical braking, this will necessitate greater effort and a longer stopping distance. A failure in the ABS or DSC systems may compromise the driver’s control over the vehicle during urgent maneuvers, elevating the likelihood of an accident. Should there be a malfunction in the integrated braking system, a warning indicator will illuminate on the dashboard.
author: Horatiu Boeriu
